Product Title: Gotham Season 4 [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2019/04/07
Store: Benjamin McKenzie  (Actor),     Donal Logue  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, TV
Product Description: ['After completing his training with the Temple Shaman (guest star Raymond J. Barry) and Ra’s al Ghul (new series regular Alexander Siddig), Bruce Wayne steps into the role of the protector of Gotham City with the help of his ever-faithful butler Alfred Pennyworth (Pertwee) and quiet support of Lucius Fox (Chalk), while building up his public persona of carefree socialite to avoid any suspicion among Gotham’s citizens. As the city sinks deeper into chaos, GOTHAM continues to follow the evolving stories of the city’s most malevolent villains: The Penguin (Taylor), Edward Nygma/The Riddler (Smith), Selina Kyle/the future Catwoman (Bicondova), Barbara Kean (Richards), Tabitha Galavan (Lucas) and Butch Gilzean (Powell).']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '6.85 x 5.39 x 0.63 inches; 5.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Actors': 'Benjamin McKenzie, Donal Logue, Robin Lord Taylor, David Mazouz, Sean Pertwee'}
Review Text: Thumbs up
Review Title: Thumbs up
Rating: 5.0

Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles

As the brave firefighters, rescue squad and paramedics deal with the aftermath of each fire they face – more hot romances, pulse-pounding action and fiery drama unfold every step of the way. raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The purchase history reveals a strong preference for high-rating drama and adventure series, emphasizing unscripted and character-driven narratives. Consistently high ratings (4.7 to 5.0) indicate a positive sentiment towards engaging plotlines with emotional depth, particularly in combat-related and medical environments. 

Themes of adventure, teamwork, and emotional turmoil recur, suggesting the individual enjoys both thrilling dynamics (as seen in competition-based formats) and intense character relationships. This pattern aligns with a taste for dramatic storytelling—specifically in series related to heroes and challenges.

Quality consistency is evident, with a clear preference for well-produced, critically acclaimed shows that deliver substantial entertainment value. The individual appears to value content that offers strong emotional responses. Price sensitivity is less apparent; given the consistent emphasis on quality irrespective of price points, it suggests a willingness to invest in superior content rather than opting for lower-cost alternatives.

Overall, the core preferences outline a consumer who prioritizes quality drama and adventure narratives, enjoys emotionally engaging stories with character complexity, and is not overly price-sensitive when it comes to securing high-value entertainment experiences.

target_interaction.title: Not as good as previous seasons
target_interaction.text: Still love the show but this season was not as good as the rest.
